artifact.art_title: System must support password authentication
System will require medical identification number and password to allow logging in
System will prevent user from trying to guess a password or enter incorrect password multiple times when logging in
System will allow the user to reset his/her password using a security question
Electronic session must terminate after a pre-determined period of inactivity. Administrator must be able to specify this period
System must support role based access
System must implement role for Patient
System must implement role for Administrator
System must implement role for Licensed Health Care Personel
System must implement role for Designated Licensed Health Car Personel
System must implement role for Emergency Responder
System must implement role for Unlicensed Authorized Personel
System must implement role for Personal Representative
System must implement role for Tester
Patient and HCP will be able to enter/edit demographics
Patient and HCP will be able to designate/un-designate DLHCP
Patient and HCP will be able to allow/disallow access to diagnosis
Patient and HCP will be able to view access log
Patient and HCP will be able to view medical records
Patient and HCP will be able to view prescription report
Patient and HCP will be able to find LHCPs for prescription renewal or chronic disease risk factors
Patient and HCP will be able to authenticate users
Patient and HCP will be able to enter/edit personal health information
Patient and HCP will be able to document an office visit
Patient and HCP will be able to proactively determine if healthcare is an office visit or procedure is due for a patient
Patient and HCP will be able to proactively confirm prescription-renewal needs of a patient
Administrator will be able to create/disable a HCP
Administrator will be able to maintain the standards list
Administrator will be able to maintain a standart list of available immunizations.
Administrator will be able to maintain the hospital list
Administrator will be able to create a LHCP and ER accounts
Administrator will be able to assign LHCP to multiple hospitals
Administrator will be able to maintain a standart list of allowable drugs using the NDC.
Administrator will be able to maintain a standart list of available diagnoses using the ICD-9CM code and a classification that the diagnosis is either chronic/long-term OR short term
Administrator will be able to maintain a listing of allowable physical services (including laboratory procedures) using LOINC code
HCP will be able to create/disable a patient
HCP will be able to declare/undeclare a personal health representative for a patient
HCP will be able to refer a patient for consultations
HCP will be able to request biusurveillance information
HCP will be able to disable patient
HCP will be able to create UAP accounts
System must support creating patients (accounts).
System will generate a unique Medical User Identification number
System will generate a secret key - patient's initial password
System must support disabling patients (accounts)
System will mark the date when patient was diabled and record optional diagnosis code as the cause of death
System must support creating and editting personel (accounts)
System will support transaction logs that will include the MID of the editor, transaction type and transaction date
System should record a log everytime Enter/edit demographics transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime View HCP, declare/undeclare LHCP as DLHCP transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime View access log transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime View medical records transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Authenticate users transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Enter/edit personal health information transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Document office visit transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Create/disable patient or HCP transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Diagnosis code transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Request biosurveillance transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Medical procedure code transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Drug code transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Identify risk factors transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Cause of Death Trends transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Declare/undeclare personal health representative transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Proactively determine necessary patient care transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Maintain a hospital listing transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime View prescription report transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime View Hospital Statistics transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime View patient comprehensive record transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime View emergency report transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Schedule Appointments transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Request Appointment transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Comprehensive Report transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Take Satisfaction Survey transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime View physician satisfaction results transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime View laboratory procedure results transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime View patient list transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Find LHCPs with experience with a diagnosis transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Send messages transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Find LHCPs for prescription renewal transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Refer a patient for consultations transaction is performed
System should record a log everytime Proactively confirm prescription-renewal transaction is performed
Patient must be able to view access log for a specified (by the patient) period of time.
System must allow designating and undesignating Licensed Health Care Professionals.
System must be able to display all LHCP that the patient has had an office visit with and allow for sorting and filtering based on last visit date and LHCP name
System will allow to search for a LHCP entering a last name or partial last name and optionally reduce the list of choices by providing the specialty and/or zip code.

Patient and Personal Representative will be able to view medical records such as personal health information (including historical values), immunizations, and office visit information (date, diagnoses, medication, name of attending physician but not notes, laboratory procedures)

The patient or personal health representative will be able to see an abbreviated health history of their siblings, parents, and both sets of grandparents for which MIDs are available in Database. They will see diagnoses related to: high blood pressure, high cholesterol, diabetes, cancer, heart disease, smoking and the cause of death if the family member has deceased.
Health Care Personel will be able to enter/edit patient's personal health records

HCP will be able to enter/edit personal health information including editing historical values, immunizations, and office visit information (date, diagnoses, medication, name of attending physician but not notes, laboratory procedures), and family history (the MIDs of the patient's mother and father).
The HCP will be able to indicate the patient has passed away, providing an appropriate diagnosis code.

System will notify patient and his personal health representative if his/her personal health record was viewed by a LHCP who is not one of the patient's DLHCP or UAP who is not associated with one of their DLHCP.
Sysem will allow for documenting office visits
LHCP will be able to document the notes of an office visit, providing the date of the office visit, and their own medical identification number.
HCP will be able to document one or more diagnoses determined during an office visit
HCP will be able to document one or more medical procedures performed during an office visit
HCP will be able to document one or more medications prescribed to the patient during an office visit
HCP will be able to document one or more immunizations given to the patient during an office visit
System will use ICD-9CM code to describe diagnoses
System will use CPT code to describe medical procedures
System will use LOINC code to describe lab procedures
System will use NDC code to describe prescribed medications
System will use CPT code to describe immunizations
Designated Licensed Health Care Personel will be able to set a personal representative for his/her patients.
System will allow determining if instances of a certain ailment is reaching epidemic proportions in a given area. System will use heurystic methods to analyze data in the database
LHCP will be able to querry the System to check for symptoms of malaria and influenza epidemy in the area given by ZIP code.
LHCP will be able to examine recent trends in diagnoses
System will identify patient's risk for Diabetes Type 1 (based on available risk factors)
System will identify patient's risk for Diabetes Type 2 (based on available risk factors)
System will identify patient's risk for Heart Disease (based on available risk factors)
System will allow to proactively determine needed patient care
System will allow to identify chronic patients who need an office visit (who have not had an office visit for more than one year)
System will allow to identify patients who need a flu shot
System will allow to identify patients who have not had proper immunizations per the immunization schedule
System will allow to view prescription report
System will allow the LHCP to view cause-of-death reports
System will allow for viewing a printable electronic health record of a patient
Electronic health record will include patient's name, age, gender and emergency contact
Electronic health record will include patient's allergies
Electronic health record will include patient's blood type
Electronic health record will include list of patient's diagnosis
Electronic health record will include list of patient's prescriptions
Electronic health record will include list of patient's immunizations
System will allow LHCP and patient to manage their appointments
LHCP and Patient will be able to request an appointment
LHCP and Patient will be able to accept an appointment
LHCP and Patient will be able to reject an appointment
LHCP and Patient will be able to view upcomming appointments
System will be able to generate a Comprehensive Patient Report
Comprehensive Patient Report will include all patient demographic information
Comprehensive Patient Report will include the entire history of personal health records
Comprehensive Patient Report will include all patient's DHCPs
Comprehensive Patient Report will include all patient's allergies
Comprehensive Patient Report will include all patient's procedures
Comprehensive Patient Report will include all patient's medications
Comprehensive Patient Report will include all patient's office visits
Comprehensive Patient Report will include all patient's known relatives
LHCP will be able to request Comprehensive Patient Report
Administrator will have to approve access to Comprehensive Patient Report for LHCP
System must implement Satisfaction Survery functionality
Patients and Health Care Representatives will be able to fill out a Satisfaction Survery relative to a previous office visit
Satisfaction Survey will ask how many minutes the patient waited in the waiting room
Satisfaction Survey will ask how many minutes the patient waited in the examination room before seeing a physician
Satisfaction Survey will ask how satisfied the patient was with the visit
Satisfaction Survey will ask how satisfied the patient was with the treatment and received information
User will be able to view Physician Satisfaction Survey Results
Satisfaction Survey Results will display physician's name
Satisfaction Survey Results will display physician's address
Satisfaction Survey Results will display average number of minutes patients wait in waiting room
Satisfaction Survey Results will display average number of minutes patients wait in examination room prior to seeing physician
Satisfaction Survey Results will display average office visit satisfaction
Satisfaction Survey Results will display average satisfaction with treatment/information
Satisfaction Survey Results will display percentage of office visits for which satisfaction information is available
System will maintain information about laboratory procedures for each patient
Patient and Personal Health Representative will be able to view status of laboratory procedures.
HCP wille ba able to edit a laboratory procedure
System will be able to send out an email alert to all iTrust users in case of important event
System will send an email alert to iTrust user who changed his/her password
System will send an email alert to a patient when patient's laboratory procedure changes status
System will send an email alert to Patient and LHCP when appointment date is accepted as scheduled.
System will send an email alert to Patient when Administrator approves the comprehensive report generation
System will send an email alert to Patient when LHCP generates the comprehensive report.
System will allow the LHCP view all his patients
System must allow patients finding a LHCP who handled given condition
System must allow messaging between patient and LHCP
Patient must be able to request prescription renewal from LHCP
HCP must be ableto refer a patient to another HCP for consultations
System will identify patient by his/her unique Medical identification number (MID)
System will store patient's address information
System will store patient's emergency contacts
System will store patients insurance company information
System will store patient's blood type
System will store patient's ethnicity
System will store patient's gender
System will store patient's parents information
System will store patient's allergies information
System will store patient's height
System will store patient's width
System will store patient's blood pressure
System will store patient's cholesterol
System will store information if patient is a smoker
System will store patient's prescription history
System will store risk factors for Type 1 diabetes
System will store risk factors for Type 2 diabetes
System will store risk factors for heart disease
